results.title: Australian diary. No. 011
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The desert is the setting for Australian boom town Whyalla, showing its development as a port and shipbuilding centre. Stars show their artistry at the ice carnival in Sydney. The Public Library of New South Wales is considered everyman’s university, and the collections of books, manuscripts and paintings are examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 009
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Information and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: This film of life in Australia in 1948 looks at the Dental College in Sydney, sheep dog trials and the Port of Sydney. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 008
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The progress made by sheep breeders is evident at the Sydney Sheep show. A burnt-out forest is salvaged for paper making in Victoria. John Seufert, a blind and handless soldier refuses to let his disability defeat him. Burrinjuck Dam provides water for irrigation in the Murrumbidgee River area.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan

results.title: Australian diary. No. 007
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: British migrants are welcomed to their new homes; in particular tradespeople arriving in Australia. Australian designers show their talents by designing garments in local wool and cotton and parading them in a Sydney department store. Ex-servicemen and women form a musical society - Melbourne services Commemoration Musical Society. Nicotine sulphate made fromplants grown in Victoria is extracted by scientists to form an insecticide to protect other plants. Surf Life Saving Clubs from around Australia compete at the national Cahmpionships held in Southport, Queensland.

results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features the following items: swimming instruction classes in New South Wales; problems with traffic in Melbourne; Aborigines show their skill with the stockwhip; Sulman architectural awards and strange animals at the Melbourne Zoo.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 003 (A)
results.creator_credit: Australian National Film Board and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a look at a Brisbane creche; Spanish monks and nuns teach Aboriginal children at New Norcia, a mission in Western Australia; families shown mining mica at Harts Range in the Northern terrotory and a Victorian fashion parade as models exhibit the latest styles in woollen clothing.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 002
results.brief_description: This diary features Kauri timber in Western Australia, Sydney from the air - how it looks from four miles up, a motor yacht regatta, Kingaroy’s peanut industry, ‘Bernborough’ winning the Doomben race, and spring at Mt. Kosciusko. No credits available.
